alert.note: Alert for Sac (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 01 at 3:23PM CST until January 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Freezing Rain And Snow Late Monday Into Tuesday... .A winter storm will spread mixed precipitation across the Upper Midwest from later Monday into Tuesday. A mix of snow and freezing rain is anticipated in parts of northwest and north central Iowa, with a potential for significant ice accumulations by Monday night and light snow lingering on Tuesday. Significant uncertainty remains in the advisory area in terms of icing accumulations, as a shift in the system could greatly alter ice amounts. Travel impacts are likely during this time frame, in addition to power outages. ...ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Significant icing expected. Ice accumulations of one quarter to four tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northwestern Iowa. * WHEN...From 6 PM Monday to 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be very treacherous. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
